variant.question:
The radio altimeter is required to indicate zero height AGL as the main wheels touch down on the runway
For this reason, it is necessary to

options.text: compensate for residual height and cable length.
have a specific radio altimeter dedicated to automatic landing.
change the display scale in short final, in order to have a precise readout.
adjust the gross height according to the aeroplane instantaneous pitch angle.

If the altimeter indicated 0 ft when the aircraft was parked for the night, and 1 000 ft the following morning, this shows that

options.text: the barometric pressure has decreased by approx. 33 hPa.
the barometric pressure is constant, but the temperature has fallen during the night.
the barometric pressure has increased by approx. 33 hPa.
a formation of fog has most probably taken place.

1. The capacitance is proportional to distance between plates

The radio altimeter 
1  operates in the 1600-1660 kHz range 
2  operates in the 4200-4400 MHz range 
3  measures a frequency difference

A serviceable altimeter indicates the elevation of the point selected, plus the height of the altimeter above this point, within a tolerance of

options.text: ± 25 m or 80 ft for altimeters with a test range of 0 to 50 000 ft.
± 15 m or 30 ft for altimeters with a test range of 0 to 60 000 ft.
± 20 m or 60 ft for altimeters with a test range of 0 to 50 000 ft.
± 25 m or 80 ft for altimeters with a test range of 0 to 30 000 ft.

variant.question: During the pre-flight inspection of a multi-engined turbine aeroplane, you notice that the angle of attack sensor is damaged. Which one of the following systems will be affected?
In a radio altimeter, the height measurement is based upon

options.text: a frequency modulation wave, for which the frequency difference between the transmitted wave and the received wave after ground reflection is measured.
a pulse transmission, for which time between transmission and reception is measured on a circular scanning screen.
a wave transmission, for which the frequency shift by DOPPLER effect after ground reflection is measured.
a triangular amplitude modulation wave, for which modulation phase shift between transmitted and received waves after ground reflection is measured.

variant.question: What does a radio altimeter, for an aircraft in the landing configuration, measure?

options.text: Height of aircraft wheels above the ground.
Height of the aircraft above the ground.

variant.question: What is an altitude that is usually be given by an altimeter?
For most radio altimeters, when a system error occurs during approach the

options.text: DH lamp flashes red and the audio signal sounds.

options.text: reduce the effect of friction in the linkages.
inform the crew of a failure of the instrument.
allow damping of the measurement in the unit.

variant.question: What are the consequences of a radio altimeter failure during an autoland?

options.text: The radio altitude indication will disappear.
The flare mode will not engage at the correct altitude.
The alert height is increased by another 100’ to increase the safety margin.
The aircraft automatically initiates a go-around.

variant.question: What happens if, during an automatic approach and landing, the radio altimeter fails?

options.text: The automatic landing system will NOT be able to perform the flare phase.
The Glide Slope mode will NOT be operational.
The automatic landing system will be fully operational.
The automatic braking sequence will be impacted.

variant.question: In case of a Radio Altimeter (R/A) failure, the ability to perform an automatic landing is...NOT affected because the GPS altitude is used.NOT affected because the barometric altitude is used.affected because the R/A is used during the tracking of the glide path.affected because the R/A is used during the automatic flare.

options.text: affected because the R/A is used during the automatic flare.
NOT affected because the GPS altitude is used.
affected because the R/A is used during the tracking of the glide path.
NOT affected because the barometric altitude is used.

When required, the ground proximity warning system (GPWS) must automatically provide distinctive warning to the flight crew of:
1) impending stall.
2) excessive sink rate.
3) altitude loss after take-off or go-around.
4) incorrect landing configuration.
5) excessive rate of terrain closure.
6) excessive bank angle.

The low-altitude radio altimeters used in precision approaches:
 
1. Operate in the 1540-1660 MHz range.
2. Are of the pulsed type.
3. Are of the frequency modulation type.
4. Have an operating range of 0 to 5000 ft.
5. Have a precision of +/- 2 feet between 0 and 500 ft and +/- 1.5% whichever is the greatest.

is used only by the radio altimeter indicator.
is used by the automatic pilot in the altitude hold mode.

the relative height of the aircraft above airport level (AAL).
the relative height of the aircraft with regard to the runway.

variant.question:
A Ground Proximity Warning System (GPWS) generates automatically a distinct warning to the flight crew with aural and/or light warning signals in the case of:
1) an excessive rate of descent with respect to terrain.
2) a dangerous proximity to the ground.
3) a loss of altitude following take-off or go-around.
4) an abnormal pitch attitude.
5) an abnormal landing configuration.
6) an abnormal deviation below ILS glide slope.
The combination regrouping all the correct statements is:
A radio altimeter employing a continuous wave signal would have:

options.text: a directional aerial for transmission and another one for reception
a directional aerial for both transmission and reception
an omni-directional aerial for transmission and directional aerial for reception
a directional aerial for transmission and an omni-directional aerial for reception

If an aircraft is flying (with flaps and landing gear retracted) in proximity to terrain and its GPWS (Ground Proximity Warning System) get activated, because it is detecting that the aeroplane has an excessive Rate of Descent, the system provides the following aural warning signals:

options.text: 'SINK RATE, SINK RATE' followed by 'WHOOP WHOOP PULL UP' (twice)
'TOO LOW, TERRAIN' (twice) followed by 'TOO LOW GEAR' (twice)
'TERRAIN, TERRAIN' followed by 'WHOOP WHOOP PULL UP' (twice)
